meanings.definition: The failure of a gift of personal property in a will because the property no longer belongs to the testator's estate at the time of death.
meanings.sent1: The ademption of the antique clock from the will puzzled the family.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer explained that ademption occurs when the gifted item is no longer available.
meanings.sent3: The ademption of the rare painting from the will left everyone scratching their heads.
meanings.sent4: The ademption of the family heirloom felt like losing a piece of history.
meanings.sent5: The sudden ademption of the jewelry made the will feel incomplete.

meanings.definition: The process by which a specific legacy or bequest is revoked or satisfied by the testator before their death.
meanings.sent1: The ademption of the monetary gift was a surprise to the beneficiaries.
meanings.sent2: Before his passing, the grandfather decided on the ademption of the land to his grandson.
meanings.sent3: The ademption of the vacation home was a generous act by the testator.
meanings.sent4: The ademption of the trust fund felt like a weight lifted off the family's shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The deliberate ademption of the antique collection showed careful planning by the testator.
